instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message: I have on the bench an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, so it is an Early 2013 15". the first time I saw it on my bench the screen would randomly flicker and the laptop would crash. I resoldered <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and it seemed to fix it, but a week later it is back on my bench. According to the customer,  after it is running for a while it would crash. I myself only got it to crash once with a GPU Kernel Panic error, saying something about "mux-reg 3" or something of that nature. I measured <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH1</SIGNAL> and it has 900mV even though the screen went black, but after the screen turned off. After few moments the whole machine would turn off. I noticed the battery has a "service me" label but I assume this is a separate issue. So far at idle, I am able to run it for the past hour without the SSD and no crashing. I don't see in "About this Mac" if this machine has a discrete GPU. Any Ideas? Or is the GPU toast?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message: I used HWMonitor and it says the SSD  has 63% service life left, though I am not sure if that is helpful.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message: I actually have 3 of these machine. Early 2013 15" Retinas with the same issue. On #2 though, when screen goes black, The GPU VCORE goes to 0V so I am assuming <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> may have broken solders.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message: I'm assuming since I still get <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH1</SIGNAL> & PH2 even when screen goes black that the GPU is faulty. On the second <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> when the screen goes black, GPU VCORE drops to 0V, so I would think that is <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. Am I correct in my thinking?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message:
Did you resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> for the 3 machines?
If GPU VCORE goes off is not a certain sign of bad <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>.
Depends of which kind of fault develops GPU in that moment.

You can try to disable discrete GPU, as there is an easy hardware mod, already posted on the forum.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message: No, I only resoldered <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> on the first one. I guess I could do the other two as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message:
Machine 1: Screen goes black but GPU VCORE stays at 900mV. Shows kernel panic. NO Liquid damage or drops

Machine 2: Screen goes black and GPU VCORE goes to 0V. NO known Liquid damage or drops. No Kernel panic

Machine 3: Randomly freezes and requires a restart. No known liquid damage or drops.

Just wanted to note that they are all exhibiting different faults. NOt asking to solve all three at once :) though would be nice to get them all fixed and out of here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message: Update: Machines 2 & 3 are fixed with <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> reflow. Machine 1 still having issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message: Try disabling GPU for that one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU Kernel Panic
threads.message: I re-soldered <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and it is no longer kernel panicking or crashing. Stress tested for 2 hours and it seems to be resolved. Thank you for your help.
